article_title: CFOs Attempt to Rally Risk Busters
article_text:
Many corporate finance chiefs, facing worries ranging from cybersecurity threats to new financial regulations, are trying to build up their company’s first line of defense: teams of internal auditors.

Unlike external auditors—outsiders who inspect a company’s financial records—internal auditors, often employees, report to senior management and the board of directors. They evaluate a company’s risk-management and control systems, and...
